definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: Now, just turned twenty-six, Jen Chi was very serious about the fight against Chiang Kai-shek.
sentences.chinese: 任琪已经二十六岁了，她决心参加反蒋战争。

sentences.english: Kim Jong Il has anointed his twenty-six-year-old son Kim Jong-un as his successor.
sentences.chinese: 金正日指定二十六岁的儿子金正恩为继承人。

sentences.english: At the time Chen Qingyang was 26 years old serving as a doctor at the same place as I stayed.
sentences.chinese: 陈清扬当时二十六岁，就在我插队的地方当医生。

sentences.english: In fact, Monica was twenty-six and the guy was seventeen.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，莫妮卡二十六岁了，而那个男的只有十七岁。

definition: one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
to be in the prime of life
how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
